lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.

Tywin is a simple yet powerful personal task assistant designed to help you manage tasks efficiently. It allows you to add, mark, unmark, delete, and list tasks, including deadlines and events. Your tasks are automatically saved and loaded whenever you use Tywin, ensuring seamless task management.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Tywin.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Tywin.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
Hello! I'm Tywin, your personal assistant!
What can I do for you?
Tywin offers the following features to help you stay organized:
‚Ä¢	üìù Task Management ‚Äì Add, mark, unmark, delete, and list tasks.
‚Ä¢	üìÖ Deadlines & Events ‚Äì Set due dates for tasks and track upcoming events.
‚Ä¢	üìú Task Viewing ‚Äì View all tasks along with their status.
‚Ä¢	üíæ Auto-Save & Load ‚Äì Automatically saves tasks upon exiting and reloads them when the program starts.
‚Ä¢	üè∑Ô∏è Flexible Input ‚Äì Recognizes multiple input formats for better usability.
todo <task>	Adds a new To-Do task.	todo Read book
deadline <task> by <date>	Adds a task with a deadline.	deadline Submit report by 12/12/2025
event <event name> at <date>	Adds an event with a specific date.	event Project meeting at 6/8/2025
list	Displays all tasks with their status.
mark <task number>	Marks a task as completed.
unmark <task number>	Unmarks a completed task.
delete <task number>	Deletes a task from the list.
find <keyword>	Searches for tasks containing the keyword.	find book
bye	Saves all tasks and exits the program.	bye
‚Ä¢	Date Format: Tywin recognizes dates in the dd/MM/yyyy format (e.g., 12/12/2025).
‚Ä¢	Data Persistence: All tasks are automatically saved upon exiting and reloaded when the program starts.
‚Ä¢	File Structure: Keep all Java files inside the src/main/java folder to avoid issues with project configuration.
Goodbye! Your tasks have been saved.

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
private static final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d/M/yyyy");
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d['st']['nd']['rd']['th'] MMMM yyyy");
return null; // Return null if the date format is incorrect
// Determines the suffix for the day (1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th...)
* Represents a task with a specific deadline.
* Creates a Deadline task with a description and due date.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The due date of the task.
* Converts the Deadline task into a string format for display and saving.
* @return A formatted string representation of the task.
private LocalDate at; // Stores the event date
String formattedDate = DateUtil.formatDate(at); // Format date as "2nd December 2025"
* The {@code Parser} class is responsible for interpreting and processing user commands.
* It takes in user input, extracts relevant details, and executes the corresponding

*
  • {@code todo } - Adds a new ToDo task.

*
  • {@code deadline by } - Adds a task with a deadline.

*
  • {@code event at } - Adds an event with a specific date.

*
  • {@code mark } - Marks a task as done.

*
  • {@code find } - Searches for tasks containing a keyword.

*
  • {@code bye} - Exits the program and saves tasks.

*

Each command is processed using a {@code switch} statement, ensuring the appropriate
* method in {@code TaskList} is called to modify the task list accordingly.
public static void parse(String input, TaskList taskList) {
